result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather L. Bielawski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine $780- set up payment plan with agent
Obtain or maintain full time employment or school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

Maintain absolute sobriety
No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license

Write letter of apology to victim
Def must submit DNA sample on 1-21-16

timeConds.notes: STAYED: Huber release, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. To be used as sanction by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather L. Bielawski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility
